summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, coordinating meetings and calls regarding the Epstein case. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting in West Palm Beach, a grand jury subpoena served to a person represented by Nascimento's deceased former partner, and general case coordination.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with a federal prosecutor to schedule meetings and calls regarding the Epstein case, and referencing a client who was served a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented an individual who was served a grand jury subpoena in the Epstein case.

connections.description: Former law partners; Nascimento references Ross as his 'former partner' and is acting as inventory attorney for Ross's former client.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A federal agent served a grand jury subpoena to an individual previously represented by the late attorney Alan Ross.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Joseph Nascimento and federal prosecutors scheduled a meeting to take place in West Palm Beach, Florida.

locations: Miami, Florida 33129 (Nascimento's law firm address: 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue)
keyFacts: The correspondence shows active coordination between defense counsel and federal prosecutors in the SDNY regarding the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
A grand jury subpoena was served on July 6, 2019, to an individual who had been represented by the now-deceased attorney Alan Ross.
Joseph Nascimento, as Alan Ross's former partner and a Florida Bar-appointed inventory attorney, became involved with this client.
Multiple meetings and calls were scheduled, including an in-person meeting in West Palm Beach, indicating ongoing investigative or pre-trial activity.
The primary correspondent for the prosecution is an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, though their name is redacted in the text.
